name: 'Disaster Relief' Multiple Choice Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: What did Donna think was the character building funny part that Josh would put into his memoirs?
questions.explanation:
Her.

	While they were in his office, Josh told Donna that this incident with Carrick was going to the be the character building funny part he put into his memoirs. Donna told him she thought she was going to be that part.

questions.text: If Toby had a boat, what was he going to call it?
questions.explanation:
Jeanine.

	Earlier in the day, Toby told Josh that Mason Fuller calling people asking them if they'd like to buy a boat and for ten minutes he considered the idea and what he would name it. Later, Toby told Josh if he had a boat he would call it Jeanine.

questions.text: After the Carrick incident, who called Josh and told him to "roll with the punches"?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	As they were entering the White House, Donna told Josh that Amy called and Sam left a message for him to "roll with the punches". After Margaret told him to keep his chin up, Josh wanted to know if everyone was using a cliché thesaurus.

questions.text: Where did CJ tell the press that General Alexander was registered for gifts?
questions.explanation:
Bed, Bath, and Beyond.

	The press was wanting to know when General Alexander was going to turn in his fourth assessment. CJ reminded them that he had only been in the job a week, but was registered at Bed, Bath, and Beyond.

questions.text: To whom did Leo give most of Josh's legislative portfolio?
questions.explanation:
Angela Blake.

	Josh told Toby that Angela was a self-promoting holier than everybody kind of person. Toby didn't think she would want to leave her office to take over Josh's duties. However, he was wrong and Toby stopped Josh from walking into the office and seeing Angela with Leo.

questions.text: Who said, "I think the President's gone AWOL"?
questions.explanation:
Leo.

	At CJ's suggestion, the President went to Oklahoma to see the devastation of the tornado that whipped through the town. He ended up staying longer than planned and when Leo asked him to come back, the President hung up on him.

questions.text: According to President Bartlet, who gave him the Scopa D' Assi cards as a gift?
questions.explanation:
Frank Sinatra.

	Charlie told Will and CJ that he was tired because he spent most of the night playing Scopa D' Assi with the President, who was given the cards by Frank Sinatra, or so he said.

questions.text: Leo told Josh he wanted to take him behind the woodshed and whack him with what object?
questions.explanation:
Two by four.

	After Josh was alone in the office, Leo told him that he wanted to take him behind the woodshed and whack with a two-by-four for losing Carrick to the Republican party.

questions.text: While in a cab, Josh had the cab driver stop in front of the White House so could scream at the building.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Ryan had dinner with Josh so that he wouldn't be alone when the Congressman he was meeting didn't show up. While on the way back to the White Hosue, Josh had the cab driver stop at the Capitol. He got out of the cab and yelled, "Hey! You want a piece of me! I'm right here! I'm standing right here! Come on! Come on!"

questions.text: How much behind schedule was the President after leaving Oklahoma?
questions.explanation:
21 hours and 33 minutes.

	When the President wanted to stay for the memorial service, CJ had to put her foot down and tell the President they had to leave because he had to go back to Washington so he could govern.
